The role and activities of the
I.T.U. In space telecommunications

SYDNEY
(Australia)
Dear Sir,
At its 23rd Session held in Geneva from 11 to 31 Kay 1968* the
Administrative Council of the International Telecommunication Union
devoted particular attention to the activities of the Union in connection
with space telecowaunications and the important part it wist play in
this field*
The Council recognized that, while a growing number of inter¬
national organizations were displaying an interest in various aspects
of the peaceful uses of outer space, not all of them were fully aware
of the essential role of the X.T.U. in this field.
In consequence the Administrative Council decided that it was
necessary to draw the attention of all international organizations and of
national representatives to such organizations, to the activities and
responsibilities of the Union with a view to ensuring full cooperation
and proper coordination of the studies and efforts being undertaken by
the I.T.U. and other international organizations in the field of space
telecommunications.
The Council accordingly adopted Resolution He. 637, the text
of which appears in Annex 1 to the present letter.
